issue.title: outdoor.adspace.pro
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

Версия 4.1.22

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Yandex Browser

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://outdoor.adspace.pro/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Hi! My site is an advertising agency in the city of Krasnodar. I have already applied for domain unblocking before adspace.pro and it was done. Now the site is created on a subdomain outdoor.addspace.pro for the development of outdoor advertising. This name also falls under your filters. I ask you to exclude my site from the filters so that AdGuard users do not have problems viewing my site. I am attaching a screenshot of the problem.
![Новый рисунок](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113426262/189857173-98ea9af3-3038-4977-bd2e-1e32b5f0e688.jpg)


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/361

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
Zgaduję, że to może być związane z tym problemem - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/1984, ale u mnie w tym przypadku ten komunikat jest ukryty przez regułę kosmetyczną.

@FadeMind Dodaj proszę tę regułę:
```adblock
||pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js$xmlhttprequest,redirect=nooptext,domain=highload.to
```
do reguł użytkownika, a potem sprawdź proszę, czy problem nadal występuje.
